RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE BIT OF THAT took the lead nearing the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled through the lane. MIDNIGHT FLING gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and dueled through the stretch for second. MI YAYIS chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. BET THE QUEEN chased through the backstretch, eased outward on the turn and passed rivals outside. K K CAN gave chase, raced in the five path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. R LOVE ON THE RUN pressured the early pace but dropped back leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. GRAM'S GAL chased the leaders inside, steadied at the rail in the vicinity of the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. CHARLOTTE WEBLEY stumbled leaving the gate then gave chase, was forced widest through the turn and showed little in the lane. RIDE ON BEAUTY gave chase but faded in the three path of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Bit of That
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steadily handled lane

ENTRY.NAME: Charlotte Webley
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,chased,forced out turn,widest 1/8,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Bet the Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,eased out turn,passed rivals outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL LUCERITO took the lead leaving the chute and rated a clear pace, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the turn and was kept alert in the lane. BORN TO SIN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and settled for second best. O'RIGSBY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, angled out toward the head of the lane and came along to take third under the wire. TWO ROOM SCHOOL chased, raced in the four path of the turn and ran evenly down the lane. ROCKIN CHAIR became fractious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn then flattened. EL PACHO chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. COURT TUDOR dwelled in the gate and was slow getting into stride, picked up the chase past the half mile pole and rounded the turn in the three and four paths. LASTWALKTOFREEDOM gave chase outside and raced wide on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: O'Rigsby
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out near 1/8,came along 3rd wire

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated clear,pressured 1/4,widened rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Janu ary 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOZY'S WILDCAT took the lead toward the three quarter pole and tapered in to rate the pace, came under pressure and edged clear of Father Walsh midway on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. HOBE SOUND rounded the opening turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the turn, raced off the rail on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch and took second the final strides. FATHER WALSH rated close inside on the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, challenged toward the five sixteenths pole but dropped back off the rail midway on the far turn and was nipped from second the final strides. MR HOOVER raced off the pace in the two and three paths the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and ran evenly in the lane. NOVA BOY was shuffled back early and raced in the three path the first turn, left the turn outside, bid mildly approaching the three eighths pole, ran in the five path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. ROCKET APPEAL stalked the early pace from the three path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then weakened inside the sixteenth pole. MACY'S BOY saved ground off the pace, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, ran at the rail on the far turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Hoover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Truett Wilbur

ENTRY.NAME: Nova Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,3p 1st turn,outside 1/2,mild bid 3/8,5p turn

ENTRY.NAME: Hobe Sound
ENTRY.OWNER: Eastham Richard and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Kozy's Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,edged away turn,steady urging

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 48. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEVIL'S CANYON rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the stretch. COMEONTURNMELOOSE saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then dueled through later yards for second. COLONIAL ROAD rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, steadied in tight at the rail leaving the far turn then outfinished in the later duel for second. S S SPARTAN ENERGY raced in the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn in the three path, then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. CRISTIANO BOY saved ground, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. TRAP HOLLER stalked the early pace two deep, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then weakened. ROCKET BALLAD rounded the opening turn in the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase toward the three eighths pole, but showed little response. COOL DUDE steadied into the backstretch and was not a factor. HARDIN raced well back saving ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Devil's Canyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured nearing 1/4,rail turn,steady handling

ENTRY.NAME: Hardin
ENTRY.OWNER: Payne Jr Claude G and Tran Alex

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Co nsidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL MISSION rated the pace inside, pulled away at the rail on the far turn and was taken in hand the final furlong. HOT FUDGE SONDE settled back in the three path the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and settled for second best. C R'S MANDATE saved ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn, then flattened in the lane. SARGENT KOBE rated close inside, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, then weakened. HUMPTY GRUMPTY rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but showed little response. MONAASIB raced off the rail on the first turn then faded leaving the seven sixteenths pole. PERJURY stalked the early pace off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pulled away turn,in hand lane

ENTRY.NAME: Perjury
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,faded off rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOHAYMEN DAY chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn, eased to the outside leaving the turn and dug in to take over later yards. TALENTED CORINNA pressured the pace inside, contested even terms at the rail on the turn and took the nod passing the eighth pole, dug in under steady handling but was caught in late yards. DETERMINED COURAGE ducked out leaving the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and finished well to take third late yards. KELSEY'S ANGEL came away awkwardly, picked up the chase toward the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. SEAP set a pressured pace well off the rail, contested even terms in the three and four paths of the turn, gave up the nod passing the eighth pole and weakened past the sixteenth. CLARIFICATION chased the pace inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. KILLDRESS KAY broke a step slow, gave chase outside and raced wide on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms turn,nod past 1/8,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Seap
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,3& 4p turn,yield nod past 1/8,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Determined Courage
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,chased,off rail turn,finished well,3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Kelsey's Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Metropolitan Thoroughbreds LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since De cember 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S NOTION rounded the first turn in the four path and left the turn outside, closed to the front past the three eighths pole, raced at the rail into the far turn, bore out approaching the top of the lane but corrected course, dug in under steady handling and just lasted. R B'S THE BOSS rated close inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, dueled through the stretch for second and just missed the win. GABRIEL'S WING rounded the first turn in the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, angled wide to get around Juba's Notion leaving the turn then relented in the stretch duel for second. ISLAND D'LITE stalked the early pace, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then weakened. URBAN BANDIT saved ground. BRISTOL CHANNEL rated the pace, was met leaving the three eighths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back approaching the quarter pole and weakened at the rail on the far turn. DAREDAVITE was never a factor. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed, a claim of foul against the rider of Juba's Notion for alleged interference leaving the far turn, lodged by the rider of Gabriel's Wing.

ENTRY.NAME: R B's the Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J

ENTRY.NAME: Bristol Channel
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met past 3/8,chased,weakened rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 16200. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 17, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EDICT stalked the early pace from the two and three paths, took the lead two deep approaching the nine sixteenths pole and was rated from that point, came under pressure leaving the three eighths, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, drifted in the upper stretch but dug in under steady handling to hold on. EXCALIBUR rated close to the early pace inside then eased out and stalked leaving the second turn, challenged past the seven sixteenths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn, drifted mid-stretch but came back to finish well. LOST IN MANHATTAN raced off the pace in the three and four paths, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then dueled through the stretch for third. FINAL SAY settled off the pace about the four path, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path then relented in the stretch duel for third. TRIPLE JEOPARDY raced off the pace about the four path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and flattened inside the eighth pole. SOUTHSIDE WARRIOR saved early ground then eased out past the half mile pole, gave chase from the seven sixteenths, raced in the five path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. LIQUID LOUIE raced off the pace about the five path, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole then faded nearing the far turn. TAPPIN FOR GLORY settled off the pace and off the rail, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened into the lane. MUSICAL AMERICA set the early pace inside, was met nearing the nine sixteenths pole and gave brief chase, but faded through the backstretch and was eased the final quarter mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Excalibur
ENTRY.OWNER: Honoring Luke Stables and Kenworthy John C

ENTRY.NAME: Southside Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out past 1/2,chased 7/16,5p far turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Tappin for Glory
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J
